member.name: T:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames
member.summary: Contains the names of common MSBuild properties.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.AdditionalLibPaths
member.summary: Specifies additional folders in which compilers should look for reference assemblies.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.AddModules
member.summary: Causes the compiler to make all type information from the specified files available to the project you are compiling. This property is equivalent to the /addModules compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ALToolPath
member.summary: The path where AL.exe can be found. This property overrides the current version of AL.exe to enable use of a different version.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ApplicationIcon
member.summary: The .ico icon file to pass to the compiler for embedding as a Win32 icon. The property is equivalent to the /win32icon compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ApplicationManifest
member.summary:
Specifies the path of the file that is used to generate external User Account Control (UAC) manifest information. Applies only to Visual Studio projects targeting Windows Vista.
In most cases, the manifest is embedded. However, if you use Registration Free COM or ClickOnce deployment, then the manifest can be an external file that is installed together with your application assemblies. For more information, see the NoWin32Manifest property in this topic.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.AssemblyOriginatorKeyFile
member.summary: Specifies the file that's used to sign the assembly (.snk or .pfx) and that's passed to the ResolveKeySource task to generate the actual key that's used to sign the assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.AssemblySearchPaths
member.summary: A list of locations to search during build-time reference assembly resolution. The order in which paths appear in this list is meaningful because paths listed earlier takes precedence over later entries.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.AssemblyName
member.summary: The name of the final output assembly after the project is built.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.BaseAddress
member.summary: Specifies the base address of the main output assembly. This property is equivalent to the /baseaddress compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.BaseIntermediateOutputPath
member.summary: The top-level folder where all configuration-specific intermediate output folders are created. The default value is obj\.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.BaseOutputPath
member.summary: Specifies the base path for the output file. If it is set, MSBuild will use OutputPath = $(BaseOutputPath)\$(Configuration)\.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.BuildInParallel
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether project references are built or cleaned in parallel when Multi-Proc MSBuild is used. The default value is true, which means that projects will be built in parallel if the system has multiple cores or processors.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.BuildProjectReferences
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether project references are built by MSBuild. Automatically set to false if you are building your project in the Visual Studio integrated development environment (IDE), true if otherwise. -p:BuildProjectReferences=false can be specified on the command line to avoid checking that referenced projects are up to date.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.CleanFile
member.summary:
The name of the file that will be used as the "clean cache." The clean cache is a list of generated files to be deleted during the cleaning operation. The file is put in the intermediate output path by the build process.
This property specifies only file names that do not have path information.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.CodePage
member.summary: Specifies the code page to use for all source-code files in the compilation. This property is equivalent to the /codepage compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.CompilerResponseFile
member.summary: An optional response file that can be passed to the compiler tasks.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Configuration
member.summary: The configuration that you are building, generally Debug or Release, but configurable at the solution and project levels.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.CscToolPath
member.summary: The path of csc.exe, the C# compiler.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.CustomBeforeMicrosoftCommonTargets
member.summary: The name of a project file or targets file that is to be imported automatically before the common targets import.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.DebugSymbols
member.summary:
A boolean value that indicates whether symbols are generated by the build.
Setting -p:DebugSymbols=false on the command line disables generation of program database (.pdb) symbol files.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.DebugType
member.summary: Defines the level of debug information that you want generated. Valid values are "full," "pdbonly," "portable", "embedded", and "none."

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.DefineConstants
member.summary:
Defines conditional compiler constants. Symbol/value pairs are separated by semicolons and are specified by using the following syntax:
symbol1 = value1 ; symbol2 = value2
The property is equivalent to the /define compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.DefineDebug
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether you want the DEBUG constant defined.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.DefineTrace
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether you want the TRACE constant defined.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.DelaySign
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether you want to delay-sign the assembly rather than full-sign it.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Deterministic
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether the compiler should produce identical assemblies for identical inputs. This parameter corresponds to the /deterministic switch of the compilers.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.DisableFastUpToDateCheck
member.summary: A boolean value that applies to Visual Studio only. The Visual Studio build manager uses a process called FastUpToDateCheck to determine whether a project must be rebuilt to be up to date. This process is faster than using MSBuild to determine this. Setting the DisableFastUpToDateCheck property to true lets you bypass the Visual Studio build manager and force it to use MSBuild to determine whether the project is up to date.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ErrorReport
member.summary: Specifies how the compiler task should report internal compiler errors. Valid values are "prompt," "send," or "none." This property is equivalent to the /errorreport compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ExcludeDeploymentUrl
member.summary:
The GenerateDeploymentManifest task adds a deploymentProvider tag to the deployment manifest if the project file includes any of the following elements:
- UpdateUrl - InstallUrl - PublishUrl
Using ExcludeDeploymentUrl, however, you can prevent the deploymentProvider tag from being added to the deployment manifest even if any of the above URLs are specified. To do this, add the following property to your project file:
true
Note: ExcludeDeploymentUrl is not exposed in the Visual Studio IDE and can be set only by manually editing the project file. Setting this property does not affect publishing within Visual Studio; that is, the deploymentProvider tag will still be added to the URL specified by PublishUrl.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.FileAlignment
member.summary: Specifies, in bytes, where to align the sections of the output file. Valid values are 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192. This property is equivalent to the /filealignment compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.FrameworkPathOverride
member.summary: Specifies the location of mscorlib.dll and microsoft.visualbasic.dll. This parameter is equivalent to the /sdkpath switch of the vbc.exe compiler.

summary.para: The DocumentationFile property lets you specify a file name for the XML file that contains the documentation for your library. For IntelliSense to function correctly with your documentation, the file name must be the same as the assembly name and must be in the same directory as the assembly. If you don't specify this property but you do set to true, the name of the documentation file defaults to the name of your assembly but with an .xml file extension. For this reason, it's often easier to omit this property and use the property instead.

If you specify this property but you set GenerateDocumentationFile to false, the compiler does not generate a documentation file. If you specify this property and omit the property, the compiler does generate a documentation file.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.GenerateDocumentationFile
member.summary: A boolean parameter that indicates whether documentation is generated by the build. If true, the build generates documentation information and puts it in an .xml file together with the name of the executable file or library that the build task created.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.GenerateFullPaths
member.summary: Generate full paths for filenames in output by using the -fullpaths compiler option.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.GenerateSerializationAssemblies
member.summary: Indicates whether XML serialization assemblies should be generated by SGen.exe, which can be set to on, auto, or off. This property is used for assemblies that target .NET Framework only. To generate XML serialization assemblies for .NET Standard or .NET Core assemblies, reference the Microsoft.XmlSerializer.Generator NuGet package.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.IntermediateOutputPath
member.summary: The full intermediate output path as derived from BaseIntermediateOutputPath, if no path is specified.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.KeyContainerName
member.summary: The name of the strong-name key container.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.KeyOriginatorFile
member.summary: The name of the strong-name key file.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ModuleAssemblyName
member.summary: The name of the assembly that the compiled module is to be incorporated into. The property is equivalent to the /moduleassemblyname compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectExtensionsPath
member.summary: Specifies the path where project extensions are located. By default, this takes the same value as BaseIntermediateOutputPath.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.MSBuildTreatWarningsAsErrors
member.summary: A boolean value that tells MSBuild to treat all warnings as errors, unless they're suppressed.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.MSBuildWarningsAsErrors
member.summary: Specifies a list of warning codes to treat as errors. Separate multiple warnings by semicolons. If you are using the .NET SDK property WarningsAsErrors, MSBuildWarningsAsErrors will default to the value of WarningsAsErrors.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.MSBuildWarningsAsMessages
member.summary: Specifies a list of warning codes to suppress by treating them as low-importance messages. Separate multiple warnings by semicolons. Note that some warnings emitted by MSBuild cannot be suppressed by using this property; to suppress them, use the command-line switch -warnAsMessage. If you are using the .NET SDK property NoWarn, MSBuildWarningsAsMessages will default to the value of NoWarn.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.NoLogo
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether you want compiler logo to be turned off. This property is equivalent to the /nologo compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.NoStdLib
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether to avoid referencing the standard library (mscorlib.dll). The default value is false.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.NoVBRuntimeReference
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether the Visual Basic runtime (Microsoft.VisualBasic.dll) should be included as a reference in the project.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.NoWarn
member.summary: Suppresses the specified warnings. Only the numeric part of the warning identifier must be specified. Multiple warnings are separated by semicolons. This parameter corresponds to the /nowarn switch of the compilers.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.NoWin32Manifest
member.summary:
A boolean value that indicates whether User Account Control (UAC) manifest information will be embedded in the application's executable. Applies only to Visual Studio projects targeting Windows Vista. In projects deployed using ClickOnce and Registration-Free COM, this element is ignored. False (the default value) specifies that User Account Control (UAC) manifest information be embedded in the application's executable. True specifies that UAC manifest information not be embedded.
This property applies only to Visual Studio projects targeting Windows Vista. In projects deployed using ClickOnce and Registration-Free COM, this property is ignored.
You should add NoWin32Manifest only if you do not want Visual Studio to embed any manifest information in the application's executable; this process is called virtualization. To use virtualization, set <ApplicationManifest> in conjunction with <NoWin32Manifest> as follows:
- For Visual Basic projects, remove the <ApplicationManifest> node. (In Visual Basic projects, <NoWin32Manifest> is ignored when an <ApplicationManifest> node exists.) - For C# projects, set <ApplicationManifest> to False and <NoWin32Manifest> to True. (In C# projects, <ApplicationManifest> overrides <NoWin32Manifest>.) This property is equivalent to the /nowin32manifest compiler switch of vbc.exe.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Optimize
member.summary: A boolean value that when set to true, enables compiler optimizations. This property is equivalent to the /optimize compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OptionCompare
member.summary: Specifies how string comparisons are made. Valid values are "binary" or "text." This property is equivalent to the /optioncompare compiler switch of vbc.exe.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OptionExplicit
member.summary: A boolean value that when set to true, requires explicit declaration of variables in the source code. This property is equivalent to the /optionexplicit compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OptionInfer
member.summary: A boolean value that when set to true, enables type inference of variables. This property is equivalent to the /optioninfer compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OptionStrict
member.summary: A boolean value that when set to true, causes the build task to enforce strict type semantics to restrict implicit type conversions. This property is equivalent to the /optionstrict switch of the vbc.exe compiler.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OutDir
member.summary: Indicates the final output location for the project or solution. When building a solution, OutDir can be used to gather multiple project outputs in one location. In addition, OutDir is included in AssemblySearchPaths used for resolving references.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OutputPath
member.summary: Specifies the path to the output directory, relative to the project directory.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OutputType
member.summary:
Specifies the file format of the output file. This parameter can have one of the following values:
- Library. Creates a code library. (Default value.) - Exe. Creates a console application. - Module. Creates a module. - Winexe. Creates a Windows-based program.
For C# and Visual Basic, this property is equivalent to the /target switch. The output type can be automatically overridden by inferencing. See OutputType set to WinExe for WPF and WinForms apps. Disable inferencing by setting DisableWinExeOutputInference to true.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.OverwriteReadOnlyFiles
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether you want to enable the build to overwrite read-only files or trigger an error.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.PathMap
member.summary: Specifies how to map physical paths to source path names output by the compiler. This property is equivalent to the /pathmap switch of the compilers.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.PdbFile
member.summary: The file name of the .pdb file that you are emitting. This property is equivalent to the /pdb switch of the csc.exe compiler.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Platform
member.summary: The operating system you are building for. Examples for .NET Framework builds are "Any CPU", "x86", and "x64".

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ProcessorArchitecture
member.summary: The processor architecture that is used when assembly references are resolved. Valid values are "msil," "x86," "amd64," or "ia64."

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ProduceOnlyReferenceAssembly
member.summary: A boolean value that instructs the compiler to emit only a reference assembly rather than compiled code. Cannot be used in conjunction with ProduceReferenceAssembly. This property corresponds to the /refonly switch of the vbc.exe and csc.exe compilers.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.ProduceReferenceAssembly
member.summary: A boolean value that when set to true enables production of reference assemblies for the current assembly. Deterministic should be true when using this feature. This property corresponds to the /refout switch of the vbc.exe and csc.exe compilers.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.RemoveIntegerChecks
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether to disable integer overflow error checks. The default value is false. This property is equivalent to the /removeintchecks switch of the vbc.exe compiler.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.RootNamespace
member.summary: The root namespace to use when you name an embedded resource. This namespace is part of the embedded resource manifest name.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_AlgorithmId
member.summary: The ID of the AL.exe hashing algorithm to use when satellite assemblies are created.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_BaseAddress
member.summary: The base address to use when culture-specific satellite assemblies are built by using the CreateSatelliteAssemblies target.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_CompanyName
member.summary: The company name to pass into AL.exe during satellite assembly generation.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Configuration
member.summary: The configuration name to pass into AL.exe during satellite assembly generation.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Description
member.summary: The description text to pass into AL.exe during satellite assembly generation.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_EvidenceFile
member.summary: Embeds the specified file in the satellite assembly that has the resource name "Security.Evidence."

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_FileVersion
member.summary: Specifies a string for the File Version field in the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Flags
member.summary: Specifies a value for the Flags field in the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_GenerateFullPaths
member.summary: Causes the build task to use absolute paths for any files reported in an error message.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_LinkResource
member.summary: Links the specified resource files to a satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_MainEntryPoint
member.summary: Specifies the fully-qualified name (that is, class.method) of the method to use as an entry point when a module is converted to an executable file during satellite assembly generation.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_ProductName
member.summary: Specifies a string for the Product field in the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_ProductVersion
member.summary: Specifies a string for the ProductVersion field in the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_TargetType
member.summary: Specifies the file format of the satellite assembly output file as "library," "exe," or "win." The default value is "library."

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Title
member.summary: Specifies a string for the Title field in the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Trademark
member.summary: Specifies a string for the Trademark field in the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Version
member.summary: Specifies the version information for the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Win32Icon
member.summary: Inserts an .ico icon file in the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Satellite_Win32Resource
member.summary: Inserts a Win32 resource (.res file) into the satellite assembly.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.SGenToolPath
member.summary: An optional tool path that indicates where to obtain SGen.exe when the current version of SGen.exe is overridden.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.SGenUseProxyTypes
member.summary:
A boolean value that indicates whether proxy types should be generated by SGen.exe. This applies only when GenerateSerializationAssemblies is set to on.
The SGen target uses this property to set the UseProxyTypes flag. This property defaults to true, and there is no UI to change this. To generate the serialization assembly for non-webservice types, add this property to the project file and set it to false before importing the Microsoft.Common.Targets or the C#/VB.targets.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.SkipInvalidConfigurations
member.summary: When true, generate a warning on invalid platform and configuration combinations, but do not fail the build; when false or undefined (the default), generate an error.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.StartupObject
member.summary: Specifies the class or module that contains the Main method or Sub Main procedure. This property is equivalent to the /main compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.SubsystemVersion
member.summary: Specifies the minimum version of the subsystem that the generated executable file can use. This property is equivalent to the /subsystemversion compiler switch. For information about the default value of this property, see /subsystemversion (Visual Basic) or /subsystemversion (C# compiler options).

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.TargetCompactFramework
member.summary: The version of the .NET Compact Framework that is required to run the application that you are building. Specifying this lets you reference certain framework assemblies that you may not be able to reference otherwise.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.TargetFrameworkVersion
member.summary: The version of the .NET Framework that is required to run the application that you are building. Specifying this lets you reference certain framework assemblies that you may not be able to reference otherwise.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.TreatWarningsAsErrors
member.summary: A boolean parameter that, if true, causes all warnings to be treated as errors. This parameter is equivalent to the /nowarn compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.UseCommonOutputDirectory
member.summary: A boolean property that you can set to true when you want all build outputs in a solution to use the same output directory. If true, referenced projects' output is not copied to projects that use those dependencies, as is normally the case when this setting is false. Setting this parameter to true does not change the actual output directory of any projects; you still need to set the output directory to the desired common output directory for each project that requires it.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.UseHostCompilerIfAvailable
member.summary: A boolean parameter that, if true, causes the build task to use the in-process compiler object, if it is available. This parameter is used only by Visual Studio.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Utf8Output
member.summary: A boolean parameter that, if true, logs compiler output by using UTF-8 encoding. This parameter is equivalent to the /utf8Output compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.VbcToolPath
member.summary: An optional path that indicates another location for vbc.exe when the current version of vbc.exe is overridden.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.VbcVerbosity
member.summary: Specifies the verbosity of the Visual Basic compiler's output. Valid values are "Quiet," "Normal" (the default value), or "Verbose."

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.VisualStudioVersion
member.summary:
Specifies the version of Visual Studio under which this project should be considered to be running. If this property isn't specified, MSBuild sets it to a default value of {VisualStudioMajorVersion}.0; for instance it will be 17.0 for all versions of Visual Studio 2022.
This property is used in several project types to specify the set of targets that are used for the build. If ToolsVersion is set to 4.0 or higher for a project, VisualStudioVersion is used to specify which sub-toolset to use. For more information, see Toolset (ToolsVersion).

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.WarningsAsErrors
member.summary: Specifies a list of warnings to treat as errors. This parameter is equivalent to the /warnaserror compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.WarningLevel
member.summary: Specifies the warning level to pass to the compilers for warnings emitted by the compiler. This setting doesn't affect MSBuild warnings, which do not have level designations. See Warning Level in the C# compiler documentation and /W (Warning level) in the C++ compiler documentation.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.WarningsNotAsErrors
member.summary: Specifies a list of warnings that are not treated as errors. This parameter is equivalent to the /warnaserror compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Win32Manifest
member.summary: The name of the manifest file that should be embedded in the final assembly. This parameter is equivalent to the /win32Manifest compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Win32Resource
member.summary: The file name of the Win32 resource to be embedded in the final assembly. This parameter is equivalent to the /win32resource compiler switch.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.TargetFramework
member.summary: Framework that this project targets. Must be a Target Framework Moniker (e.g. netcoreapp1.0).

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.TargetFrameworks
member.summary: Semi-colon separated list of frameworks that this project targets. Must be a Target Framework Moniker.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.TargetFrameworkMoniker
member.summary: Specifies the version of the .NET Framework that is required to run the application that you are building. Specifying this lets you reference certain framework assemblies that you may not be able to reference otherwise.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.SatelliteResourceLanguages
member.summary: Semi-colon separated list of culture names to preserve satellite resource assemblies during build and publish. Names must be a valid culture name (like en-US;it; or fr). If left empty, all satellite resource assemblies will be preserved. Defaults to empty.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.RepositoryType
member.summary: The type of the repository where the project is stored (e.g. git)

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.RepositoryUrl
member.summary: The URL of the repository where the project is stored

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.Nullable
member.summary: Set the nullable annotations and warnings context for the C# project. Possible values are enable, disable, warnings and annotations.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.LangVersion
member.summary: Specifies the version of the programming language the project uses

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.CommonPropertyNames.AllowUnsafeBlocks
member.summary: Specifies whether to allow code blaocks in the project

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.FrameworkSDKRoot
member.summary: Path to the root folder for .NET Framework tools.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.InnerBuildProperty
member.summary: Specifies the property name that defines the multitargeting build dimension (applicable only if the current build is a graph build).

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.InnerBuildPropertyValues
member.summary: Specifies the property name that holds the possible values for the InnerBuildProperty (applicable only if the current build is a graph build).

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.IsGraphBuild
member.summary: True if this is a graph build; that is, the -graphBuild option is in effect. This option means that MSBuild constructs and builds a project graph. Constructing a graph involves identifying project references to form dependencies. Building that graph involves attempting to build project references prior to the projects that reference them, differing from traditional MSBuild scheduling.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildAssemblyVersion
member.summary: The version of MSBuild assemblies used to build the project.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildBinPath
member.summary:
The absolute path of the folder where the MSBuild binaries that are currently being used are located (for example, C:\Windows\Microsoft.Net\Framework\<versionNumber>). This property is useful if you have to refer to files in the MSBuild directory.
Do not include the final backslash on this property.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildExtensionsPath
member.summary:
Introduced in the .NET Framework 4: there is no difference between the default values of MSBuildExtensionsPath and MSBuildExtensionsPath32. You can set the environment variable MSBUILDLEGACYEXTENSIONSPATH to a non-null value to enable the behavior of the default value of MSBuildExtensionsPath in earlier versions.
In the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier, the default value of MSBuildExtensionsPath points to the path of the MSBuild subfolder under the \Program Files\ or \Program Files (x86) folder, depending on the bitness of the current process. For example, for a 32-bit process on a 64-bit machine, this property points to the \Program Files (x86) folder. For a 64-bit process on a 64-bit machine, this property points to the \Program Files folder.
Do not include the final backslash on this property.
This location is a useful place to put custom target files. For example, your target files could be installed at \Program Files\MSBuild\MyFiles\Northwind.targets and then imported in project files by using this XML code:
<Import Project=$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\MyFiles\Northwind.targets/>

summary.para: The path of the MSBuild subfolder under the \Program Files or \Program Files (x86) folder. The path always points to the 32-bit \Program Files (x86) folder on a 32-bit machine and \Program Files on a 64-bit machine.. See also MSBuildExtensionsPath and MSBuildExtensionsPath64.
Do not include the final backslash on this property.

The path of the MSBuild subfolder under the \Program Files folder. For a 64-bit machine, this path always points to the \Program Files folder. For a 32-bit machine, this path is blank. See also MSBuildExtensionsPath and MSBuildExtensionsPath32.
Do not include the final backslash on this property.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildFileVersion
member.summary: The 4 part version of MSBuild assemblies used to build the project.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildFrameworkToolsPath
member.summary: The path to the .NET Framework tools that the currently executing MSBuild was built with, with a trailing slash.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildFrameworkToolsPath32
member.summary: The path to the 32-bit version of the .NET Framework tools for the same framework version that the currently executing MSBuild was built with, with a trailing slash.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildFrameworkToolsPath64
member.summary: The path to the 64-bit version of the .NET Framework tools for the same framework version that the currently executing MSBuild was built with, with a trailing slash.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildInteractive
member.summary: true if MSBuild is running interactively, allowing user input. This setting is controlled by the -interactive command-line option.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildLastTaskResult
member.summary: if the previous task completed without any errors (even if there were warnings), or false if the previous task had errors. Typically, when an error occurs in a task, the error is the last thing that happens in that project. Therefore, the value of this property is never false, except in these scenarios: * When the ContinueOnError attribute of the Task element (MSBuild) is set to WarnAndContinue (or true) or ErrorAndContinue. * When the Target has an OnError element (MSBuild) as a child element.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildNodeCount
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent processes that are used when building. This is the value that you specified for -maxcpucount on the command line. If you specified -maxcpucount without specifying a value, then MSBuildNodeCount specifies the number of processors in the computer. For more information, see Command-line reference and Build multiple projects in parallel.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProgramFiles32
member.summary:
The location of the 32-bit program folder; for example, C:\Program Files (x86).
Do not include the final backslash on this property.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectDefaultTargets
member.summary:
The complete list of targets that are specified in the DefaultTargets attribute of the Project element. For example, the following Project element would have an MSBuildDefaultTargets property value of A;B;C:
<Project DefaultTargets=A;B;C >

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectDirectory
member.summary:
The absolute path of the directory where the project file is located, for example C:\MyCompany\MyProduct.
Do not include the final backslash on this property.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectDirectoryNoRoot
member.summary:
The value of the MSBuildProjectDirectory property, excluding the root drive.
Do not include the final backslash on this property.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectExtension
member.summary: The file name extension of the project file, including the period; for example, .proj.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectFile
member.summary: The complete file name of the project file, including the file name extension; for example, MyApp.proj.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectFullPath
member.summary: The absolute path and complete file name of the project file, including the file name extension; for example, C:\MyCompany\MyProduct\MyApp.proj.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildProjectName
member.summary: The file name of the project file without the file name extension; for example, MyApp.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildRuntimeType
member.summary: The type of the runtime that is currently executing. Introduced in MSBuild 15. Value may be undefined (prior to MSBuild 15), Full indicating that MSBuild is running on the desktop .NET Framework, Core indicating that MSBuild is running on .NET Core (for example in dotnet build), or Mono indicating that MSBuild is running on Mono.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildStartupDirectory
member.summary:
The absolute path of the folder where MSBuild is called. By using this property, you can build everything below a specific point in a project tree without creating <dirs>.proj files in every directory. Instead, you have just one project—for example, c:\traversal.proj, as shown here:
<Project ...> <ItemGroup> <ProjectFiles Include=$ (MSBuildStartupDirectory) **\*.csproj/> </ItemGroup> <Target Name=build> <MSBuild Projects=@(ProjectFiles)/> </Target> </Project>
To build at any point in the tree, type:
msbuild c:\traversal.proj
Do not include the final backslash on this property.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildThisFile
member.summary: The file name and file extension portion of MSBuildThisFileFullPath.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildThisFileDirectory
member.summary:
The directory portion of MSBuildThisFileFullPath.
Include the final backslash in the path.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildThisFileDirectoryNoRoot
member.summary:
The directory portion of MSBuildThisFileFullPath, excluding the root drive.
Include the final backslash in the path.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildThisFileExtension
member.summary: The file name extension portion of MSBuildThisFileFullPath.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildThisFileFullPath
member.summary:
The absolute path of the project or targets file that contains the target that is running.
Tip: You can specify a relative path in a targets file that's relative to the targets file and not relative to the original project file.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildThisFileName
member.summary: The file name portion of MSBuildThisFileFullPath, without the file name extension.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildToolsPath
member.summary:
The installation path of the MSBuild version that's associated with the value of MSBuildToolsVersion.
Do not include the final backslash in the path.
This property cannot be overridden.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildToolsPath32
member.summary:
The installation path of the 32-bit MSBuild version that's associated with the value of MSBuildToolsVersion.
Do not include the final backslash in the path.
This property cannot be overridden.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildToolsPath64
member.summary:
The installation path of the 64-bit MSBuild version that's associated with the value of MSBuildToolsVersion.
Do not include the final backslash in the path.
This property cannot be overridden.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildToolsVersion
member.summary:
The version of the MSBuild Toolset that is used to build the project.
Note: An MSBuild Toolset consists of tasks, targets, and tools that are used to build an application. The tools include compilers such as csc.exe and vbc.exe. For more information, see Toolset (ToolsVersion), and Standard and custom Toolset configurations.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildSDKsPath
member.summary: The path MSBuild uses to find SDKs.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildSemanticVersion
member.summary: The full semver 2.0 version of MSBuild assemblies used to build the project.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildVersion
member.summary:
The version of MSBuild used to build the project.
This property can't be overridden, otherwise the error message MSB4004 - The 'MSBuildVersion' property is reserved, and can not be modified. is returned.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildWarningsAsErrors
member.summary: A list of warning codes to treat as errors.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildWarningsAsMessages
member.summary: A list of warning codes to treat as messages.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.MSBuildWarningsNotAsErrors
member.summary: A list of warning codes that should not be promoted to errors even if the -warnAsError switch is set to promote all other warnings to errors. Note that it has no effect if that is not true.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.RoslynTargetsPath
member.summary: Path to targets for Roslyn compilers.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.SDK35ToolsPath
member.summary: Path to .NET Framework 3.5 tools.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.SDK40ToolsPath
member.summary: Path to .NET Framework 4.0 tools.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.VsInstallRoot
member.summary: The Visual Studio installation folder.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.WindowsSDK80Path
member.summary: Path to the Windows 8 SDK.

member.name: F:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Constants.MSBuildPropertyNames.Description
member.summary: A long description of the NuGet package for UI display

member.name: M:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Extensions.TaskExtensions.TryGetProjectInstance(Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask)
member.summary: Attempts to get the current of the executing task via reflection.
member.returns: A object if one could be determined, otherwise null..

member.name: M:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Tasks.GetCommandLineArgs.Execute
member.summary: Executes the task. This is where you get the command line arguments and properties to remove from the command line.
member.returns: True if the task executed successfully ; otherwise false. If false the task should be retried with another task

member.name: M:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Tasks.GetCommandLineArgs.Equals(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances are equal.
member.returns: true if the two specified instances are equal ; otherwise false

member.name: M:Dgmjr.MSBuild.Tasks.GetCommandLineArgs.GetHashCode(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a hash code for the specified object. This is used to determine whether or not a object is the same as another object in the same language.
member.param: The object to get a hash code for.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified object or if the object is the same as another object in the same language
